intro: Hieracium calvens, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium calvens is often found in rocky or grassy areas and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions.
